zbXFCeFJrQ4C-bX63-S9lQ.text: When you want A simple pleasure in life and don't care about calories.. Double Lucky Boy Burger (mustard) with fries and a strawberry shake :)

IVk6t9GRSwfkMWpRQ2n0Rw.text: We went there tonight and were met with smiles. The fries were nice and crispy which led me to believe they change their oil often and the burger tasted like a really good hamburger from the snack bar at the beach.  The chocolate malt, let me tell you, they don't skimp on the Carnation Malt. Uncle Benny was in tonight and apparently he's known all this for years.

llD-C4cywMY4MTPKwzn5kQ.text: This is the perfect example of why Yelp is important. I would have driven by this place a hundred times and never gone in. I took a peek at the reviews and was shocked to see that this place is a 4 star with 153+ reviews. I made a u-turn and tried them out.  At first, the math didn't add up. I was charged $9.33 when I should have been charged $8.21. I didn't make a fuss because I wanted to try the food first because sometimes being overcharged doesn't matter if you get a good value.  I ordered the international half pound burger with fries and a coke. The burger was absolutely perfectly cooked, and the sauce was just right - not too much and not too little. The fries tasted unsalted, which is probably a good thing, and doesn't matter too much to me because I basically use fries as edible ketchup spoons.  All together the food was absolutely perfect and the customer service was excellent. They are super friendly. I even got to chatting with them about how I've driven by this place dozens of times and would have never came in if it wasn't for Yelp.  I would have given 5 stars, but I don't think I got $9.33 in value.  With that said, try this place! I can see myself coming here too often.

ucwuAUbs1ZrZYtwivrNWpg.text: Pretty damn good and very cheap. Went with a work buddy and we both got a burger and fries for about 5.00 a piece. The place is kind of a dump with no AC but I would go back for sure.

O0g9qNFksuzBxWY9zF_img.text: First visit, LOVED IT!! Such friendly people and prices are inexpensive.  I would have taken a picture of my International Lucky Burger...but it was crazy delicious and I ate it before I could take a picture.  Definitely will be going back!! Thumbs up!   If you're looking for a classic burger and shake joint, this is definitely the spot!

oK7zQ6xBrlHIMIy4BPHGkQ.text: Driven by this place a hundred times. Decided to try the drive thru. Glad I did. Fries perfectly crispy and piping hot. I appreciate the fact they were not over salted. Double International burger tasted fresh and delicious. Banana shake wow! Unique one of a kind place and flavor. Will be back again for sure.

fhEUDLN4h3OWAiKZSihTfw.text: Best burgers in Arizona!! Better than in-N-out and better than any burger restaurant around!! Amazing deals on the burger and fries, less than $5!! The meat is high quality, the fries are steak cut (yummy and not cheap) and the overall good quality is superb!! The indoor restaurant is very very clean and the people working there are very very nice and friendly! LOVE YOU!!! Thank you for making our experience amazing every single time!!  A+++++!!

oUOiOsXd3ks1Ekataa5WWQ.text: At the request of a coworker, who heard on the radio that today is "National Cheeseburger Day", I went to pick up lunch. Here is a transcript of my stream of consciousness:  [pull into the parking lot at 16th Street and Osborn] Wow. This place is behind a gas station, and it looks exactly like a place behind a gas station. Gulp. Oh man, hepatitis-on-a-stick. But I can't back out now because our order is called in and Coworker is so super excited about trying this place out. Okaaay...  [open the door to the shack/restaurant. It's small and nearly packed, which makes sense because there were hardly any parking spots left. There are several people working behind the counter and at the grill, and the first thing that strikes me is how jubilant and friendly they are]  "Hello! You're at Lucky Boy! What can we get you today?" [Everyone is smiling. Like genuinely smiling from real happiness, not the I'm-smiling-because-management-makes-me]  I'm taken aback because the staff is so happy despite having less than 100 square feet of work space, in a building that, from the outside, looks like it was abandoned. I pay for the order (cheap!), turn the greasy doorknob and go back to my car. On the drive back to work I pull out a French fry and it is HOT. Like good hot from well-cared-for oil. Not just hot because it was recently out of the fryer. Eat enough fast food, and food in general, like I do and you can tell the difference.   Larger than most fast food fries, I eat the first French fry. It is crispity-crunchy on the outside and warm and potato-y on the inside. Mmmmmmmm. These are some unique fries. I take to holding one at a time in front of the a/c to before eating it slowly.   Back in the break room, we enjoy "Lucky International 1000 Island" 1/4 lb. burgers and a side of mushrooms. The proportion of meat, bun, lettuce, 1000 Island and pickles was perfect. The mushrooms were good but hard to judge because I knew they were degraded from the drive back to the office. I conclude that the food is enjoyable, and it is obvious that it would be REALLY GOOD if we ate it on site. I'm excited about returning, om nom nom!

NCiRvUMK3ayYRLXRxV7Rnw.text: We are in absolute LOVE with this little "Mom & Pop" burger shop! The only downside we've noticed is the fact they aren't open when we suddenly get the urge for an extremely well-done meal.  It's almost always: 1/4 lb BBQ Lucky Burger for my boyfriend and the 1/4 lb charbroiled chicken sandwich for me. Lucky Boy has the BEST fries in Phoenix - we could make a meal out of the fries alone!!!  The first time we went there, dubiously, because we hadn't tried the fare - when we pulled up to the menu, we were both amazed at how simple and straightforward it is; first time through - a cherry shake. OMG! It was like frozen cherry-flavored heaven in a cup. Thick and very cherry, it was probably the BEST thing we both put in our mouths that day. ;o)~  We decided that since the shake was extra delicious (we shared a medium - was NOT disappointed - perfect size for two, too much for just one) that we'd go back and this time get real FOOD.  He got the Lucky Boy burger and so did I. We also purchased mushrooms which put us over the edge - it was SO. MUCH. FOOD.   The second time we got the 1/2 lb Lucky Boy BBQ burger for him and the charbroiled chicken for me, no mushrooms this time - instead, we opted for an order of fries. Got up to the window to pay and receive our food and the guy inside said: "You know the burgers come with fries, right?" I smiled, nodded, and said, "Yes, thank you. We'd still like another order." He kind of shrugged his shoulders, took my money, and said, "Okay..."  A few minutes later, he appeared back at the window with TWO bags of food... literally, one held our burgers and fries, the other was "BAG 'O FRIES!!!" I think we kind of overdid it that time... didn't expect THAT many fries. Live and learn, right? We ate dinner at home then basically lay back in our respective chairs bemoaning the fact that "Holy Hannah! That's A LOT of fries!!!"  We've since turned this into 'go-to' place every Saturday. It's the one place we've decided will definitely get our business on Saturdays after we've done the antiquing, shopping, and doing what "old" people do on their weekends.  My suggestion? Go to LUCKY BOY at least once in your life. The place is small, the drive-thru is tight, there's no restroom, but the FOOD - oh, the food! If I could, they'd get TEN stars!!!

8WtP72I2wMY3vSh4ht6iaw.text: Great burgers, well priced, nice selection and family owned. Everyone that works here has been a pleasure to deal with.

8jcijPPrdJnWuBl08PjfGA.text: As I walked up to this classic looking burger stand in Phoenix I put an image in my head. I told myself I wanted the burger special with cheese. I also said I wanted it to have shredded lettuce, tomato, and ketchup. This is exactly what I got open flame grilled burger, grill toasted bun for unparalleled flavors.  Reminded me of a burger stand from my childhood.  Oh and for some odd reason I pictured a squeeze bottle for the ketchup. When. The fries came out the squeeze bottle was their next to them. No nasty pump of warm ketchup from fresh from the fridge, clean and full.  All in all a delicious little spot. See you again soon!

HhhXSf3Fx33HwSwyZ3Rl2w.text: Hands down.  THE BEST IN PHOENIX.  Take all the fancy spancy places and forget them.  This is the best hole in the wall in the valley.

36332U_cC6LOQL9cLZ5sqw.text: Great local burger shop.  The people were very nice.  The cheeseburger was fantastic.  We'll be back.

sLPZReXAWcEO-GZJjydq5Q.text: This place couldn't be any more 'real'!  I'd heard about it from a bunch of friends, and lots of yelp reviews!  And "it tasted just as expected it would", old fashioned if you will.  Sure you can get a Fancy Burger, [Hopdoddy is good for that] but this is different.  They've been doing it since 1951!!!  I got a huge burger and as recommended, got the 1000 island dressing as my sauce.  I got a big bag of super crispy, perfect fries too, and it was $6.69.  Yikes what a deal.  I had a great conversation with the owner and his team and they have that 'simple and relish' thing and attitude down pat!  TRY THIS NOW!

cu7Y0hZXRTk4Xsab1JTWeA.text: I am been craving greasy food! I seriously I. Love with this place...why, you ask because the onion rings are amazing, they are perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of Lucky Boy Burger Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

QFQMqgb7l1xsxsWe2tA1dw.text: Same as it ever was Same as it ever was Same as it ever was  -- Talking Heads  Yeah, not much had changed in the 24 years that passed between my last two visits. You get a burger that's a little charred. Fries and onion rings are fairly good. The atmosphere is without pretension.

Y-ClE-x3AkwtcsaELiLTCg.text: Went here yesterday after several friends raving about it and seeing mixed reviews. Very disappointed. If you want to skip the details, skip the copy cat of Lennys and actually go to the Lennys on Central and Thomas, it's only 5 minutes away. Not worth trying.  My wife ordered a 1/4lb w onion rings instead of fries (which he said was possible, pretty sure it was the owner), I ordered a 1/2lb with cheese with fries, and a large drink. It was $16 and change. First I thought there's no way having looked at their prices which are very reasonable, then thought well things add up. So I paid. Come to find out as I'm adding it on my phone as I wait for my food (as it was bothering me), the cashier basically just charged full price for the onion rings and we didn't get the fries. So that's annoying considering we paid for the fries anyways and didn't get them. Granted we wouldn't have eaten them but still, if you can't upgrade to onion rings for the difference then you can't say you can get them instead of fries. Charging full price for them and trying to hide it is shady.  The service was friendly, there was no one there, so the food came out quick. My wife's burger was cooked normally but her bun was stale and it had only a few shreds of lettuce. My burger was the same only my bread was REALLY stale. The 1/2lb is two patties so requires a little "squishing", the bread was too stale to do this effectively. I'm not a complainer so I ate it. As far as the burger goes, seriously very chincy on the produce which helps make the burger, and the burger was eh, no taste other than grease, no seasoning, not juicy. Boring. Not even in the ballpark of the best fast burger in town. Shouldn't even be on the radar.  Fries are decent, pretty sure they are the same as Lennys. Onion rings (12 per order) are nothing special, concerned a lot of other users say they are the best they have had. Perhaps this is really good "beer food". ????  No refills on soda. Come on. Even Lennys (that they are copying) does refills for free or $0.50 depending on location. Soda syrup is so cheap it's insane.   Knowing that we wouldn't be returning. It wanted to get the full experience as others really enjoyed the shakes. I was feeling fat from my uneventful burger, so I got a small Butterfinger shake. We took this to go and this was really good. Prices about average for the size.  So all in all, unless you want a quick drive through, skip this place and go to Lennys. Same menu but smaller without the taste.
